subject: Sexual Health
title: DNA and Genetic Inheritance
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on DNA and Genetic Inheritance.

hook.text: You share 99.9% of your DNA with every other human. The tiny remainder makes you entirely unique.

buildup.text: Gregor Mendel discovered inheritance patterns by crossing pea plants in the 1860s.

discovery.text: DNA carries instructions for building proteins, which determine traits like eye color and height.

twist.text: Dominant genes can mask recessive ones. Two brown-eyed parents can have a blue-eyed child.

climax.text: Every child inherits a random mix of parental DNA, making each person a genetic original.

punchline.text: Your DNA is a remix no one has heard before.

quiz.question: What did Mendel discover through pea plant experiments?
